1.t: Someone has (needlessly) demanded to experience the torment (of God),

2.t: which will inevitably seize the disbelievers.

3.t: No one can defend him against God, the Lord of the exalted positions.

4.t: On that Day (of Judgment), long as fifty thousand years, the angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him.
4.tr: Ta'rujul malaaa'ikatu war-Roohu ilaihi fee yawmin kaana miqdaaruhoo khamseena alfa sanah

6.t: They think that it (the Day of Judgment) is far away.

7.t: but We see it to be very near.

8.t: On the day when the heavens become like molten metal.

9.t: and the mountains become like wool,

10.t: even intimate friends will not inquire about their friends,

11.t: though they may see each other. A sinner will wish that he could save himself from the torment of that day by sacrificing his children,
11.tr: Yubassaroonahum; ya-waddul mujrimu law yaftadee min 'azaabi yawma'izim bibaneeh

13.t: his kinsmen who gave him refuge (from hardship)

14.tr: Wa-man fil ardi jamee'an summa yunjeeh

15.t: By no means! For the raging flames of the fire

17.t: and drag into it anyone who has turned away (from obeying God),

18.t: and who accumulated wealth without spending it for a good purpose.

20.t: When they are afflicted, they complain,

21.t: but when they are fortunate, they become niggardly

24.t: They are those who assign a certain share of their property

25.t: for the needy and the deprived,

26.t: who acknowledge the Day of Judgment,

27.t: who are afraid of the torment of their Lord,

28.t: the punishment of their Lord is not something for them to feel secure of,

30.t: except from their wives and slave girls, in which case they are not to be blamed,
30.tr: Illaa 'alaaa azwaajihim aw maa malakat aymaanuhum fa-innahum ghairu maloomeen

31.t: but whoever goes beyond this is a transgressor;
31.tr: Famanib taghaa waraaa'a zaalika fa-ulaaa'ika humul 'aadoon

32.t: who honor their trust and promises,

33.t: who testify to what they have witnessed,

34.t: and (finally) those who do not miss their ritual - prayers at the prescribed times;

35.t: such people will receive due honor in Paradise.

36.t: What is wrong with the disbelievers who roam around you (Muhammad),

37.t: left and right, in numerous groups?

38.t: Does every one of them desire to enter the bountiful Paradise?
38.tr: Ayatma'u kullum ri'im minhum any yudkhala jannata Na'eem

39.t: By no means! For they know very well out of what We have created them (The human being's naturally growing from a living germ, without discipline and good deeds will not result in virtue).

40.t: I do not need to swear by the Lord of the eastern and western regions that We have certainly all the power
40.tr: Falaaa uqsimu bi-Rabbil mashaariqi wal-maghaaribi innaa laqaadiroon

41.t: to replace them by a better people and none can challenge Our power.
41.tr: Alaaa an nubaddila khairan minhum Wa-maa nahnu bi-masbooqeen

42.t: (Muhammad), leave them alone to dispute and play until they face the Day with which they have been threatened:
42.tr: Fazarhum yakhoodoo Wa-yal'aboo hattaa yulaaqoo yawma-humul lazee yoo'adoon

43.t: the Day when they rush out of their graves as if racing towards a signpost,
43.tr: Yawma yakhrujoona minal ajdaasi siraa'an ka-anna-hum ilaa nusubiny yoofidoon

44.t: with their eyes cast down and covered by disgrace; the day about which they were promised.
44.tr: Khaashi'atan absaaruhum tarhaquhum zillah; zaalikal yawmul lazee kaanoo yoo'adoon
